keyTakeAways: Lance Bass has type 1.5 diabetes, also known as latent autoimmune diabetes of adulthood (LADA).
He uses the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System to effectively track his blood sugar levels.
Bass created an online persona called 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate and entertain people about diabetes with humor, developed accidentally through Instagram content.
He identifies white rice and white bread as foods that significantly spike his blood sugar, even with minimal consumption.
His uncle had type 1 diabetes, which influenced his early awareness of diabetes-related dietary restrictions.
Advancements in diabetes monitoring technology have greatly improved his ability to manage his condition.
Stress from his demanding career and parenting responsibilities affects his blood sugar levels.
He has no current plans for an *NSYNC reunion, stating that there is no breaking news on the matter.
Bass expresses skepticism about recent media reports on *NSYNC reunions, claiming they lack accuracy.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Lance Bass, a former *NSYNC member, discusses his personal experience with type 1.5 diabetes, also known as LADA, emphasizing how advancements in technology like the Dexcom G7 monitoring system have transformed his daily management. He shares insights into how certain foods—like white rice and white bread—trigger dangerous blood sugar spikes. Bass created the online persona 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate and entertain audiences about diabetes through humor. Despite fan speculation about a possible *NSYNC reunion, he confirms there is no current plan and expresses skepticism about media reports. The article highlights the intersection of personal health, public awareness, and fan engagement in the entertainment world.
title: Lance Bass Has More to Say About Living with Diabetes Than He Does About an *NSYNC Reunion
